question.question_subtype: Select One or More Answer Choices
question.stimulus: This is a stimulus for a test
question.question_stem: The __________ you choose will help your readers __________ your message. If you provide too many __________ within a single sentence, though, your readers may lose sight of your main point.

explanations.A: Incorrect. Examples help illustrate points, but details are more crucial for conveying your message clearly.
explanations.B: Incorrect. Themes are the underlying messages or ideas in a work but are not as specific to the structure of a sentence.
explanations.C: Correct! Details add depth and specificity to your writing, making it easier for readers to understand.
explanations.D: Incorrect. Analogies provide comparisons but do not convey detailed information the way details do.

explanations.E: Incorrect. Emphasize is related to highlighting but does not directly relate to how readers interpret your message.
explanations.F: Incorrect. Losing sight of the main point happens when there are too many details, not when choosing details.
explanations.G: Correct! The goal of details is to help readers understand the message clearly.
explanations.H: Incorrect. Ignoring would indicate a lack of attention, which is not the intended purpose of details in writing.

explanations.I: Correct! Too many details in a sentence can overwhelm the reader and obscure the main point.
explanations.J: Incorrect. Examples support ideas, but too many of them also don't obscure the main point as much as excessive details do.
explanations.K: Incorrect. Themes are broader concepts and less specific to the structure of a sentence in this context.
explanations.L: Incorrect. Analogies are used to explain ideas but aren't the main focus of this particular issue.

question_details.learning_outcome: Students will apply the principles of clarity and conciseness in writing.
question_details.learning_objective: This topic explores how to choose the appropriate amount of detail to improve the effectiveness of written communication.
